item.title: Hair Confidence by Devils
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Devils debuts on OJST with this sweet, personal story about cutting her hair short for the first time! Man, reading this took me back to the first time I shaved my head in college and what a transformative experience that was. At the start of the quarantine, I decided to let my hair grow out […]
item.content:encoded:
Hair Confidence by Devils

by Matthew Nolan on 06/15/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Interviews

Devils debuts on OJST with this sweet, personal story about cutting her hair short for the first time! Man, reading this took me back to the first time I shaved my head in college and what a transformative experience that was. At the start of the quarantine, I decided to let my hair grow out until I got vaccinated. By the time I was getting my shot, my hair was well past my shoulders and I had spent the last year under lockdown not recognizing myself in the mirror. Finally, getting to hack all that heavy hair away earlier this month? I know what Devils means when she writes “It was like the haircut had freed me.” in her comic.

People have such deeply personal relationships with their hair and we’ve got a few more comics on the topic in our archives here at ol’ Oh Joy Sex Toy! Give’em a gander:
Body Hair Blues by Tess Thompson

Body Hair Blues by Tess Thompson

item.title: FleshSack
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan

When I first ran into the FleshSack (yes I know, that name 0_o), I thought it was some sort of FleshLight Aprils fools. It seemed so out of place amongst all the orifice-focused toys they make, and definitely not something that would appeal to […]
item.content:encoded:
FleshSack

by Matthew Nolan on 06/08/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

I’ve been looking forward to this review for months and months.

When I first ran into the FleshSack (yes I know, that name 0_o), I thought it was some sort of FleshLight Aprils fools. It seemed so out of place amongst all the orifice-focused toys they make, and definitely not something that would appeal to me. But I was shocked by how much horny mental space it decided to occupy in my head. Balls on a Fleshlight; after all… why not? Why shouldn’t I keep try it? What started as a giggle turned into a must have. I HAD to experience those balls slappin’ up against me. A rare purchase for me.

And gosh was I not disappointed. This toy exudes FUN. Sure, there are better toys out there, but are they as much FUN to slap up against? I’m not sure.

This comic makes me miss going to our local She Bop SO friggin’ MUCH!

It was an absolute delight to get today’s saucy nsfw comic from G! It’s just the right flavor and speed for the start of the summer- from what I’ve been reading, it’s supposed to be a horny summer, too, with more and more folks reappearing from the lockdown full vaccinated and feeling amorous. I hope today’s comic inspires! =D

Go tell G they’re awesome!

Erika and I took last week off as we dealt with the second covid vaccination (short story: it wiped us OUT), slowly getting back into the roll of the schedule!

item.title: Tenga Geo
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: You know what. I ain’t afraid to say it. I friggin LOVE the Geo. Love LOVE. It’s strange – I never expected to find a line of toys that would ‘connect’ to me when I started reviewing for OJST. I always thought that a toy was a toy, some would be better than others, and […]
item.content:encoded:
Tenga Geo

by Matthew Nolan on 05/18/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

You know what. I ain’t afraid to say it. I friggin LOVE the Geo. Love LOVE.

It’s strange – I never expected to find a line of toys that would ‘connect’ to me when I started reviewing for OJST. I always thought that a toy was a toy, some would be better than others, and my donger wouldn’t be particular either way. But over the years I’ve developed a better sense of what it is exactly that me and my willy like best. It turns out it’s LOOKS and TEXTURES. Both of which Tenga is KING.

I can’t recommend the Geo enough (for those with average or smaller cocks.) However, it’s not widely stocked and might wear out quickly. If you don’t mind the same experience but shaped in a TUBE rather than an ORB (which hasn’t ever ‘torn’ for me) – I can 100% recommend Geo’s younger sibling, the 3D (reviewed here in 2013!!!) if you can find it; most folks we work with in the menu-bar stock it!

by Matthew Nolan on 05/11/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Smutty Comics

Today’s comic is a fun lil NSFW reminder that we all deserve a sexy break or two, made by the lovely Tila!

Go visit their Twitter and Patreon if you’re keen to see more of these two, I know they’ve gone and drawn them up at least once more in anticipation of the comic going up.

Tila’s just wonderful and deserves all of your follows and kind words.

  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Tomorrow – May 12th



Come to our free, live book chat with Emily Nagoski through Charis Books tomorrow!!! We’re gunna be talking about our book for teens about sex and relationships, Let’s Talk About It.

Wednesday, May 12th @ Charis Books

4:30pm PST / 7:30pm EDT


If you’ve read through our archives or, y’know, pay attention to the New York Times Best Sellers lists, you won’t wanna miss our talk with Emily Nagoski. She is the award-winning author of the New York Times bestselling Come As You Are and The Come As You Are Workbook, and coauthor, with her sister, Amelia, of New York Times bestseller Burnout: The Secret to Unlocking the Stress Cycle. She earned an M.S. in counseling and a Ph.D. in health behavior, both from Indiana University, with clinical and research training at the Kinsey Institute.
Register for our Crowdcast chat at Charis Books.

└ Tags: break time, breaktime, fantasy, fiction, guest, guest comic, nswf, Perkytiddies09, Tila, work

item.content:encoded:
Mental Health Practices

by Erika Moen on 05/04/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health

To be honest, I’m struggling to write something here. When I was freshly out of the Intensive Outpatient Program, I made a comic talking about my experience there plus reviewed a vibrator, so, y’know, killin’ two birds with one stone there. More recently I made a comic explaining The Stress Response Cycle, which I touch on here but if you’re hungry for more information, well, go read that one. Brains, man! Brains.

  • Headspace App
  • Sleep Headphones (Amazon)
  • Sleepy Time Tales

Live Book Chats – May 6th & 12th


Matt and I are doing some LIVE BOOK STORE CHATS that you are totally invited to! One of them is just day after tomorrow!!!

Thursday, May 6th @ Third Place Books


6pm PST / 9pm EDT


We are delighted to talk with Clare Bayley, a sex and technology expert and Fellow at the Technology and Public Purpose Project of the Harvard Belfer Center who has just launched The Nectarine Project, which is a sex positive advocacy, research, and lobbying group.
Register for our Zoom chat at Third Place Books.

Wednesday, May 12th @ Charis Books

4:30pm PST / 7:30pm EDT


If you’ve read through our archives or, y’know, pay attention to the New York Times Best Sellers lists, you won’t wanna miss our talk with Emily Nagoski. She is the award-winning author of the New York Times bestselling Come As You Are and The Come As You Are Workbook, and coauthor, with her sister, Amelia, of New York Times bestseller Burnout: The Secret to Unlocking the Stress Cycle. She earned an M.S. in counseling and a Ph.D. in health behavior, both from Indiana University, with clinical and research training at the Kinsey Institute.
Register for our Crowdcast chat at Charis Books.

item.title: Side Effect, Right Effect, by Hien Pham
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: Ok, for reals? I literally laugh out loud every time I read this comic and get to the part where the little pants-tent alarm shouts WEE-WOO! WEE-WOO!!. This is such a lovely, thoughtful, heartfelt comic that I think a looooot of us on anti-depressants can relate to– but that little boner alarm? Oh my god. […]
item.content:encoded:
Side Effect, Right Effect, by Hien Pham

by Erika Moen on 04/27/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Health »
  • Interviews »
  • Sex & Sexuality

Ok, for reals? I literally laugh out loud every time I read this comic and get to the part where the little pants-tent alarm shouts WEE-WOO! WEE-WOO!!. This is such a lovely, thoughtful, heartfelt comic that I think a looooot of us on anti-depressants can relate to– but that little boner alarm? Oh my god. That fucking kills me.

Hien was just here recently with another touching and funny autobio story about body image! When he pitched us with this idea for another story, we leaped for it.

Find the lovely Hien in these spots, then tell him he’s fab:

item.title: Arcwave Ion
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: I’d heard about the Arcwave Ion last year and couldn’t have been more excited to try it out. A toy that aims to emulate a clitoral orgasm for penises? HECK YES SIGN ME UP. Some of you long-term readers might remember, that Erika has tried several clitoral suction toys and hasn’t ever ‘clicked’ with them. […]
item.content:encoded:
Arcwave Ion

by Matthew Nolan on 04/20/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

I’d heard about the Arcwave Ion last year and couldn’t have been more excited to try it out. A toy that aims to emulate a clitoral orgasm for penises? HECK YES SIGN ME UP.

Some of you long-term readers might remember, that Erika has tried several clitoral suction toys and hasn’t ever ‘clicked’ with them. Welp – I guess she’s not the only one, as it’s just happened to me too!

For the life of me, I could not find my way into enjoying the Arcwave Ion. I love the futuristic promise it offers, but I think that maybe my junk is just trapped in the past. I know it can work – I’ve read some incredible reviews out there; The Big Gay Review, Phallophille Review, Super Smash Cache Review, Input Magazine Review. But I guess I’m the reviewer exception.

Different strokes for different folks! I know a friend who SWEARS by using a vibrator on his cock during masturbation – which I’ve never gotten into, personally. So maybe mild suction on the tip of your dick will be perfect for you. Consider trying it out and prove me (and Tig) wrong =D

item.content:encoded:
Chase by Innkeeper Worm

by Matthew Nolan on 04/13/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Favorites »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Smutty Comics

Another sexy-horny one for you this week, friends! I suppose all these saucy comics arriving in spring and around Easter is kind of the perfect theme =D

I love today’s comic and think Innkeeper Worm just knocked it out of the park. Wordless comics are always so tough to do and this one sings.

Go give Innkeeper Worm a follow or, better yet, hire ’em for a commission (they seem to be open to them atm).

  • Twitter

Today’s comic gave me bigggg Beastars vibes – which is a current Manga series I’ve been consuming with abandon and think is just a ton of anthropomorphic fun. So I’m gonna drop some book-plugs below, in case today’s comic piqued the furry inside of you. Come join me and read (it’s also a cartoon on Netflix too!) this crazy high school drama (with a dash of romance), set in an animal world!

  • Powells
  • IndieBound
And, finally while we much prefer and encourage you to buy from a small
business, here’s an Amazon link!
